potions_unused.flavor: Used to be a refreshing brew, now nothing more than a bottle of rot.

encounters.name: black cat
encounters.desc: A black cat is an omen to be studied seriously

encounters.name: warding charm
encounters.desc: A hanging charm wards away the borgles and grimstalks.

encounters.name: bubbling cauldron
encounters.desc: The cauldron bubbles and glows with a odorous brew.

encounters.name: Hestia
encounters.desc: Hestia has no interest in the world outside Thangmor, but will teach those who come to her.

encounters.name: Old Harold
encounters.desc: It's unnatural I tells ya, why, back in my day a wolf near a village would just become a fine pelt in a moment, youngsters these days just have no use, no use at all, a whole wolf gets into the granary and nobody bats an eye I tells ya, what would a wolf even want with a grain anyway, y'know back in my day...

encounters.name: Old Harold
encounters.desc: Hello there sonny, listen to this old man for a moment would you? This village's been awful, awful quiet lately, 'cept for the house of that one scoundrel we hung a few months ago and I could really use the company. Here's a little treat for you...

encounters.name: Fox
encounters.desc: There is a minor commotion as a fox successfully claims a chicken from an unguarded coop.

encounters.name: Fox
encounters.desc: You notice a fox furiously scratching at a house door.

encounters.desc: â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ and I better not see you visiting that old house on the outskirts!!!

encounters.name: Outsider
encounters.desc: A man stands just outside the village, visibly shaken. As you approach him, he warns you that something strange is going on in Hallomar.

encounters.name: Headcount
encounters.desc: A headcount of all the residents reveals that nobody has seen Hank for a few days. He was last seen heading north out of the village.

encounters.name: Headcount
encounters.desc: A headcount of all the residents reveals that the number of villagers is exactly as expected. Yet, you can't seem to shake the feeling that you made a mistake.

encounters.name: Subtle scratches
encounters.desc: A close inspection of the houses reveals that that different symbols have been carved into the wood. The symbols on the houses of loners are different

encounters.name: Footprints
encounters.desc: A series of muddy footprints points northwards, towards a long-abandoned windmill.

encounters.name: Berta
encounters.desc: An old woman by the name of Berta tells you a story of how even after the miller died, the mill miracuously still works, even after several years of neglect.

encounters.name: Berta
encounters.desc: A young woman by the name of Berta confides that she was visited by a ghost of a recently executed thief, who said that he will visit terrible vengeance on the village.

encounters.name: talk to hestia
encounters.desc: Hestia is busy concocting a special pumpkin brew.

encounters.name: pumpkin patch
encounters.desc: Hallomar's autumn fields grow some of the largest pumpkins to be found.

enchants.desc: Imbue your weapon with the power of the witching hour.
enchants.extdesc: Adds a special attack to the weapon.

attack.name: behead
attack.damagedesc: Deals damage equal to 300% of base weapon damage to a non-primary enemy.

enchants.name: Midnight armor
enchants.desc: Imbue your armor with the power of the witching hour.

items.name: Minute of midnight
items.desc: A tiny slice of midnight, useful for unique enchantments

rares.name: hestia's charm
rares.desc: Hestia's amulet throbs with a dull purple light.

rares.name: nymie's charm
rares.desc: A small figurine of a black cat.

upgrades_unused.name: mischievous wisps
upgrades_unused.desc: The heart of the horseman has finally dissipated. Only the faintest trace of mischief remains.
upgrades_unused.extdesc: You always satisfy the Trickery skill's requirements.

upgrades_unused.name: pumpkin harvest
upgrades_unused.desc: Even if the gourds have long spoiled, the lessons still stick with you

events.name: Mischievous spirit
events.desc: Peculiar energies permeate the hall, driving all to mischief.
